title: Can you damage a DVD by playing it in a Blu Ray player? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. Both DVDs and Blu-rays are optical media. If your player is free of debris [and I can’t think of any good reason why there would be any debris in a DVD/Blu-ray player], the only thing that comes in contact with the disc is the spin motor, and that’s only with the centre spindle. The data is read by a laser that is positioned below the disc and never touches the disc.

No. Unless the player is faulty in some way, you should be fine. Blu-ray players are made in a way that they are backwards compatible with DVD discs. If you are having trouble with playing DVDs in your player, contact the manufacturer.
